### Ella Kaye (chair)

![](images/people/ella-kaye.jpeg){.person-img width="30%"}

Ella is a Senior Research Software Engineer, working to increase sustainability and EDI (Equality, Diversity and Inclusion) in the R Project. Currently based at the University of Warwick, but moving soon to the University of Birmingham to work on enabling the next generation of contributors to R. She is also a fellow of the Software Sustainability Institute. Ella co-founded and runs rainbowR. She has many and varied hobbies including powerlifting, juggling, and playing clarinet.

### Katlyn Bagley-Sepsey

![](images/people/katlyn-bagley-sepsey.png){.person-img width="30%"}

As Director of Institutional Research, Reporting, and Data Stewardship at Furman University, Katlyn focuses on institutional data strategy, governance, and compliance. Responsibilities include aligning data systems with decision-making needs, developing and maintaining data warehousing processes, and ensuring adherence to FERPA standards. She also oversees federal and state reporting, institutional dashboards, and participation in national data exchanges.

[{{< iconify mdi:linkedin >}} LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/in/katlyn-bagley-sepsey/){.btn .icon-link}

### Tina Rozsos

![](images/people/tina-rozsos.jpg){.person-img width="30%"}

Tina is an applied microeconomist with an interest in the economics of (higher) education. She is currently a PhD student at the Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam in the Netherlands. She is also a Graduate Fellow at the University College Roosevelt Data Center and the Data Manager of CORE Econ.
